snippet: Analysts are looking at outward signs of a cultural thaw in North Korea, including shorter skirts and high heels, for clues to the thinking of its new leader.
abstract: Analysts are looking at outward signs of a cultural thaw in North Korea, including shorter skirts and high heels, for clues to the thinking of its new leader, Kim Jong-un; North Korea analysts can hardly be blamed for trying to cobble together whatever scraps of information they can find, as the world knows precious little about Kim; figuring him out, however, is critical to determining the extent of the threat from the secretive nation.
lead_paragraph: Analysts are looking at outward signs of a cultural thaw in North Korea, including shorter skirts and high heels, for clues to the thinking of its new leader.

headline.seo: Experts on North Korea Can See a Lot in a Hemline
headline.main: North Korea Experts Can See a Lot in a Hemline
headline.print_headline: Korea Experts Can See a Lot In a Hemline
